reset-dialog.message: Are you sure you wish to reset the application? This clears all cached data, settings and keys.

connect-page.description: Connect the Buttercup extension to the Buttercup Desktop application so you can use your vaults and entries to easily access your web-based accounts.
connect-page.instruction: The desktop application should have appeared. If it hasn't, please close this page and try again. You must have opened the desktop application before trying. Wait for an authorisation code to appear in the desktop application, and then enter it here:
connect-page.title: Connect desktop application

code.desktop-connection-not-authorised: Desktop connection has not been authorised

error.fatal-boundary: A fatal error has occurred - we're sorry this has happened. Please check out the details below in case they help diagnose the issue:

invalid.required-non-empty: Invalid: value is required (cannot be empty)

check-error.description: Unable to establish a connection to the desktop application. Check that it's open or consider re-authenticating.
check-error.title: Connection Failed

remove-dialog.message: Are you sure that you want to remove the vault "{{vault}}"?

empty.description: No vaults have been added to your desktop application, yet.
empty.title: No Vaults

no-connection.description: You haven't connected to the desktop application, yet.
no-connection.title: Not Connected

save-credentials-dialog.description: One or more logins have been recorded and are ready to be saved to your vault.
save-credentials-dialog.error-description: We weren't able to get the details you wanted, sorry.
save-credentials-dialog.title: Save Login

no-vaults.description: No vaults are currently available. Either add a vault or unlock some.
no-vaults.title: No Available Vaults

save-credentials-page.description: Save detected login details to a connected vault. Make sure to first unlock the vault you wish to save to in the desktop application.
save-credentials-page.title: Save Logins

dropbox.description: Host your vault within your Dropbox cloud storage account, so that you can access it from any device you own. You must have an account with Dropbox to be able to use this vault type.
dropbox.title: Dropbox

googledrive.description: Host your vault within your Google Drive cloud storage, so that you can access it from any device you own. You must have a Google account to be able to use this vault type.
googledrive.title: Google Drive

localfile.description: Use the Buttercup desktop application to supply access to local files on your computer. Requires the desktop application to be installed and running.
localfile.title: Local File

webdav.description: Use the DAV protocol that certain services provide to store your vault. Self-hosted cloud storage providers such as Nextcloud and ownCloud support this protocol, allowing you to access your vault from any device you own.
webdav.title: WebDAV
